data.description:
It's the lite "Updated Watch" (You can get the full "Updated Watch" on the AppStore).

This design Watchface has an amazing style and font.
Features :
- Multilingual
- Date (Days, months) and time + seconds
- Display of the bluetooth connection
- Display of the battery level

Options can be configurable :
- Activate or deactivate bluetooth deconnection vibe
- Activate or deactivate bluetooth connection vibe
- Activate or deactivate bluetooth deconnection light
- Activate or deactivate bluetooth connection light
- Active or deactivate second
- Change the Watchface theme

Compatible Pebble classic, Pebble Time and Pebble Round.

Should you find mistakes dont hesitate to contact me.

If you like this Watchface, please add your « heart » to the top :).

data.description: Inspired by retro video games... as usual.
data.title: TIA

data.author: Konrad Strachan

changelog.release_notes:
Added Pebble 2 support.
Improved display on monochrome screens via use of dithering.
Implemented scaling for new pop-under notifications watch OS v4.
Fixed bug relating to old activity data not being cleared properly when the day changes.

Corrected bug in configuration page where the date would be the opposite of what was selected
Updated to use latest SDK and bring in Clay via dependencies
Improved configuration page to use Clay framework.

Now respects 12/24 hour option set in watch
Added ability to configure date format and disable emoji

Added special radial drawing mode for Chalk platform
Fixed bug preventing devices without HealthAPI from ever showing the watchface (instead getting stuck on the 'please wait' screen)
Fixed bug sometimes preventing the time from being displayed when the watchface first appears until the minute changes

Now compatible with aplite platform.
Tweaked where the lines are drawn by one pixel.
Added drawing code for B&W aplite platform.

Added function to only update the 'current' data for the last hour when signaled by the API that there is an update.
Added protection from responding to events from the API too frequently, this radically reduces power consumption.
Loading of persisted data is handled better, old 'current' data from the last day is no longer loaded in when the day changes.

Added explanation of when the watchface is loading health data and the user should be patient.
Tweaks to improve CPU and battery usage.
Transition between reading health / persisted data back to watchface now faster.

Greatly improved loading time by caching health data to prevent reloading when switching to and from the watchface.
Added date.
Added emoji showing whether the wearer is doing well (relative to their average exercise for the last week) or not.
First release.

data.description:
A watch face that tells the time and integrates with Health API to show information about activity in the last 24 hours (with hour granularity) vs average data for the last week. An emoji indicates how well the wearer is doing in matching their average exercise for each point in time relative to their activity from the previous week. 

 * Supports Pebble OG and Steel (Aplite), Time and Steel (Basalt), Round (Chalk) and Pebble 2 (Diorite)
 * Shows activity for current and previous day for each hour
 * Shows historical activity for each our averaged over the last week
 * Supports 12/24 hour time display
 * Shows date in both MM-DD and DD-MM formats
 * Optimised display for round screen Pebble watches
 * Snazzy emoji that celebrates your achievements and prods you to be more active

UPDATE - 1.10 Added Pebble 2 support.
Improved display on monochrome screens via use of dithering.
Implemented scaling for new pop-under notifications watch OS v4.

UPDATE - 1.9 Fixed bug relating to old activity data not being cleared properly when the day changes.

UPDATE - 1.8 Corrected bug in configuration page where the date would be the opposite of what was selected

(change logs from earlier versions not shown due to space limitations)

latest_release.release_notes:
Added Pebble 2 support.
Improved display on monochrome screens via use of dithering.
Implemented scaling for new pop-under notifications watch OS v4.

changelog.release_notes:
V1.3 (17.04.2016)
Added option to change units:
Distance: miles or kilometres
Temperature: Celsius or Fahrenheit

V1.2 (15.04.2016)
Bug fixes (issues with updating traffic and weather info on original Pebble)

V1.1 (14.04.2016)
Added option to enter your own Google Maps API Key
V1.0 (04.2016) - First Realese

data.description:
Traffic and Weather watchface display is divided in 3 areas:

1. Top area:
● Bluetooth connection status
● Battery charge level
● Current time
● Current date

2. Middle area:
● Driving time to your chosen address (taking into account current traffic conditions). If you are at home, it will show driving time to your work address. If you are not at home, it will show driving time to your home address. Home and work addresses need to be entered in watchface settings.
● Driving distance and average driving time to the above address (without taking into account current traffic conditions).
● Last travel info update status.
● Last travel info update time.

3 Bottom area:
● Current weather conditions.
● Last weather update status.
● Last weather update time.

Weather information is provided by Open Weather Map.
Travel and traffic information is provided by Google Maps.
It's recommender that you get your own (free) Google Maps API key, since built-in key now regularly hits daily 2,5000 limit (when this happens you will see message "query limit exceeded"). They key can entered in settings and instruction on how to obtain it can be found here:
http://www.mysysadmintips.com/other/programming/694-get-google-maps-distance-matrix-api-key

Distance can be displayed in miles or kilometres; Temperature - in Celsius or Fahrenheit.

latest_release.release_notes:
V1.3 (17.04.2016)
Added option to change units:
Distance: miles or kilometres
Temperature: Celsius or Fahrenheit

NEW in Version 3.0:
  - Added support for Pebble Time Round watches.

NEW in Version 2.0:
  - Support for displaying the temperature in celcius.
  - The first accent color now uses pebble's normal color pallette instead of the sunny color pallette.

Sessions is a simple digital watchface for Pebble Time watches. It features the following capabilities:

* 12-hour and 24-hour time display
* Customizable colors
* Month and day display
* Counts steps
* Displays current temperature

Uses font named Lobster by Pablo Impallari and Alexei Vanyashin. License information:

http://scripts.sil.org/OFL

data.description:
Watch face from an idea I had back in November, why not have a poppy on your Pebble watch thus PoppyTime was born. This is an analogue style watch face using the Poppy flower as the watch. 

The hour hand is represented by the light green stem and the minutes are represented by the dark green leaf. 

Supports both the Pebble Time Round and the Pebble Time watches.

Thanks for looking and trying face out. It's my first one ;) thanks to the Pebble community and London meetup group.

data.description:
Minimalin is a fully customizable watchface that blends analog and digital for a simple, modern and elegant look.
Minimalin is an open source project. If you love it as much as we do, feel free to tap the HEART! 🙂

• Fully configurable colors (save your themes!)
• Weather conditions and temperature
• Date display
• Steps from Pebble Health
• Low battery icon
• Bluetooth disconnected icon (pick your favorite)
• Rainbow hand!

Designed by @AlessioLaiso. Developed by @groyoh.

A super slick round analogue watchface for Pebble Classic, Pebble Time and Pebble Time Round.

Highlights include:
* Dark colour scheme for best clarity and ultimate slickness.
* Hour, minute and second hands
* Bluetooth connected indicator (vibrates on disconnect)
* Battery level indicator (turns red at 20% and under on watches with a colour display)
* Month and day

data.author: Tomas Kafka

changelog.release_notes: Weathergraph now checks if the weather is outdated more often, which should increase a probability that the phone is actually online during the request → hopefully less 'weather is outdated' screens. Let's cross fingers :).

FIX: No more vibrates on start when the Pebble is already disconnected (it was annoying as it happens after every notification etc.).

NEW: Vibrate on bluetooth disconnect - due to popular demand 😜.
Only for Pebble Time/Pebble 2 though, no more RAM left on Classic Pebbles. 

Two options: 2 short taps, or a long pulse.

NEW: Vibrate on bluetooth disconnect - due to popular demand 😜. 
Only for Pebble Time/Pebble 2 though, no more RAM left on Classic Pebbles.

Two options: 2 short taps, or a long pulse.

⛄️ Weather update! 
Added 'feels-like' temperature (takes wind intensity and wind temperature into account) option to Dark Sky weather provider (free Yr.no doesn't have feels-like temperature).
Fixed a case where Weathergraph only showed 2 day forecast on 1st gen Pebbles with Dark Sky enabled. Oops :).
Fixed a case where Weathergraph only showed 2 day forecast on 1st gen Pebbles with Dark Sky enabled. Oops :).

Pebble Time/PT Steel & Pebble 2:
🌞/🌚 Real day/night times (marked by dark bars under the graph). Long nights in winter, long days in summer. 
Also useful when watching weather in a different time zone - what time of day do they have?

🔠 Option to have a bigger time font instead of health data. Yay!
More themes on Pebble Time, yay! :)

Higher precision for first 8 hours on Pebble Classic & Pebble Steel (same as what newer Pebbles get for the whole forecast - previously 1st gen Pebbles got only 3 hour resolution due to RAM constraints).

When Weathergraph cannot get location (for example because it's off on the phone), it uses last successfuly acquired location instead.
When Weathergraph cannot get location (for example because it's off on the phone), it uses last successfuly acquired location instead.

⚠️ Dark Sky (Forecast.io) forecasts! 

Weathergraph now supports the awesome Dark Sky service with their precise and hyperlocal forecast. A global service that works on every continent. Turn it on in app settings. (Note: Dark Sky is a paid service and so it is enabled as a part of Weathergraph Pro package)

⚠️ Dark Sky (Forecast.io) forecasts! 

Weathergraph now supports the awesome Dark Sky service with their precise and hyperlocal forecast. A global service that works on every continent. Turn it on in app settings. 

(Note: Dark Sky is a paid service and so it is enabled as a part of Weathergraph Pro package)

⚠️ Dark Sky (Forecast.io) forecasts! 

Weathergraph now supports the awesome Dark Sky service with their precise and hyperlocal forecast. A global service that works on every continent. Turn it on in app settings.
(Note: Dark Sky is a paid service and so it is enabled as a part of Weathergraph Pro package)
Fix: A bit smaller watchface size
🕐 Seconds! Turn them on in settings. Also, tweaked AM/PM (smaller font). Enjoy!

🌎 A time of rejoice - you can now add multiple manual locations and toggle between them quickly in settings. 

Going to Reykjavík or Jakarta next week? Check out the weather there :).
This also works around a problem where on some Android phones Pebble app cannot access location. 

And, lastly, using manual location of course saves phone battery :). 

Enjoy!

Fixes: Fixed bug where config didn't open.

🌎 A time of rejoice - you can now add multiple manual locations and toggle between them quickly in settings.
Going to Reykjavík or Jakarta next week? Check out the weather there :).

This also works around a problem where on some Android phones Pebble app cannot access location.

And, lastly, using manual location of course saves phone battery :). Enjoy!

Fixes:
Fixed bug where config didn't open.

This update tries to fix:
- crash that sometimes prevented opening settings
- problems with getting the location when the phone location is imprecise (Weathergraph is now happy with ±5 km accuracy)

2 NEW THEMES FOR PEBBLE CLASSIC! 
Also: 5 days outlook (for Pebble Time and Pebble 2 - sorry, no RAM left on classic).

Enjoy :)
2 NEW THEMES FOR PEBBLE CLASSIC! Enjoy :)

data.description:
😱 NEW: 
- Vibrate on disconnect.
- Feels-like temperature.
- Dark Sky (Forecast.io) support.

RECENTLY: Seconds toggle. All new look. Themes. Pebble 2 and heart rate support.
Weathergraph's biggest update ever :)

---

Beautiful yet functional weather forecast watchface with a hour-by-hour level of detail that far surpasses anything else in Pebble Store.

WeatherGraph shows:
🕑 Time, of course (optionally with seconds)
❤️ Daily steps and distance - toggle HR/steps/kilometers/miles (heart rate only on Pebble 2) ← NEW
⛅️ Precise forecast from Yr.no or Dark Sky (Forecast.io)
🌡 Hour-by-hour temperature (chart at the bottom)
🌧 Hour-by-hour precipitation - rain and snow (bars at the bottom + rain/snow pattern from clouds)
☁️ Hour-by-hour ☁️ cloudiness (cloud cover) and ☀️ sunshine (clouds on top + sun rays)
🌤 Daily minimum and maximum (overlaid above chart)
❄️ Actual temperature and place (on the bottom)
📅  Date and day of month
☀️ Battery and bluetooth indicator
🕐 Configurable 1/2/3/5 day chart

All of that in an elegant visualisation.

Weathergraph is rated with 'A' battery rating from Pebble team, which means it has almost no impact on your battery life :).

Ideas? Problems? Write at facebook.com/weathergraph or to support email. Thanks!

Made in Prague.

latest_release.release_notes: Weathergraph now checks if the weather is outdated more often, which should increase a probability that the phone is actually online during the request → hopefully less 'weather is outdated' screens. Let's cross fingers :).

data.title: WeatherGraph - weather forecast, hourly and beautiful, with step counter, health and heartrate (hrm)

data.description:
The ultimate World time clock for Pebble Time and Round. Configurable for 35+ cities/time zones, including half-hour offset zones.  Online manual is provided (tap website link below).

Supports 3 favorite time zones. Cycle through the 3 favorites with a flick of the wrist, no need to use the phone to switch between favorite timezones.

Other features:
Supports 12/24 hour local clock
Weather icon with temperature in C or F (local weather)
Moon phase display
Battery load indicator
Local sunrise and sunset time
Days of week in English, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Spanish and Klingon.
A-Grade energy friendly (extremely low battery usage).
BT disconnect warning (temp goes red with optional vibration)
Keeps track of DST and timezone date
DST on dual time can be set to Automatic (US), On or Off.

This watchface comes with a bonus Watch App. Completely configurable from your wrist! The app includes an on-board compass. 

Both watchface and app for just $2.99 ! Download the watch app separately from the Pebble Store.

latest_release.release_notes: Optimized for Pebble 2

Version 1.4: Minor cosmetic changes to minute arcs.

Version 1.1: added color customization via configuration screen.
Version 1.0: Initial release.

data.description:
Time is displayed on the left side of watchface. Big arc displays minutes, large segments equals 5 minutes. Minutes continue from top to bottom on outer arc for mintues 1 through 30 and bottom to top for minutes 31 through 59. Smaller circle indicates hour. Example: 9:33

Inner circle indicates bluetooth connection. Vibrates on connect/disconnect.

Upper-right circle indicates date. Outer circle for month, inner digits for date. Example: 5 April

Bottom-right arc indicates battery level. Example: 80%. Inside arc, step counter displayed per thousands of steps.

Color scheme is now customizable via configuration screen.

latest_release.release_notes: Version 1.5: Changes to steps counter.  Full step count below 10K.

data.description:
Deceptively simple blend of binary style, analog ease, and digital accuracy.  Try out the demo mode and learn the secret.  Give it a heart if you have a heart, because it's made with love!

Hours count to 12 around the outside with the large squares.  Minutes count to 60 with small squares following a path around the interior.  Zero minutes is at 12:00, fifteen minutes at 3:00, thirty minutes at 6:00 and 45 minutes at 9:00.  It looks binary but it's really analog with the accuracy of digital.

While learning the watchface, turn on the second hand and watch as the dot follows the same path as the minutes.

latest_release.release_notes: Improve startup behaviour.

data.title: Alien Binary Analog

data.author: jdixl

changelog.release_notes:
Ever since Pebble released their Health update for Pebble Time, I find my self checking my step count more than I'd like to admit over the course of day. Now you can view all that valuable step information as soon as it comes to hand, right from your watchface!

Highlights include:
* Current Steps (turns green when you are on par or ahead of your typical steps).
* Typical Steps
* A bar graph of the steps your Pebble Time has recorded for each minute of the last hour (minutes with the most steps are displayed in green).
* Current steps per minute when your Pebble Time reports that you are moving at over 30 steps per minute.

Download now and we'll even through in:
* Day, Month and Day
* Current time
* Bluetooth connected symbol (vibrates on disconnect)
* Battery level

There are a few things you need to know:
* There may be up to a 15 minute delay in the data displayed in the bar graph of steps in the last hour. This is because Pebble only serves up this detailed information every 15 minutes (I'm guessing to preserve battery life).
* The current steps per minute is a guide only. You will see a white guide bar start to shrink each time a new current steps per minute is display to give you an indication as to how fresh the value is.

I think that's about it for now, there are a bunch of other things I'd like to do with this watchface in time, but rather than sit on it for another few months, I'd rather share it with my fellow Pebblers and hear first hand what people want.

Enjoy!

Download now and we'll even throw in:

* Bluetooth connected symbol (vibrates on disconnect)

There are a few things you need to know:
* There may be up to a 15 minute delay in the data displayed in the bar graph of steps in the last hour. This is because Pebble only serves up this detailed information every 15 minutes (I'm guessing to preserve battery life).
* The current steps per minute is a guide only. You will see a white guide bar start to shrink each time a new current steps per minute is display to give you an indication as to how fresh the value is.

I think that's about it for now, there are a bunch of other things I'd like to do with this watchface in time, but rather than sit on it for another few months, I'd rather share it with my fellow Pebblers and hear first hand what people want.

Enjoy!

latest_release.release_notes:
Ever since Pebble released their Health update for Pebble Time, I find my self checking my step count more than I'd like to admit over the course of day. Now you can view all that valuable step information as soon as it comes to hand, right from your watchface!

Highlights include:
* Current Steps (turns green when you are on par or ahead of your typical steps).
* Typical Steps
* A bar graph of the steps your Pebble Time has recorded for each minute of the last hour (minutes with the most steps are displayed in green).
* Current steps per minute when your Pebble Time reports that you are moving at over 30 steps per minute.

Download now and we'll even through in:
* Day, Month and Day
* Current time
* Bluetooth connected symbol (vibrates on disconnect)
* Battery level

There are a few things you need to know:
* There may be up to a 15 minute delay in the data displayed in the bar graph of steps in the last hour. This is because Pebble only serves up this detailed information every 15 minutes (I'm guessing to preserve battery life).
* The current steps per minute is a guide only. You will see a white guide bar start to shrink each time a new current steps per minute is display to give you an indication as to how fresh the value is.

I think that's about it for now, there are a bunch of other things I'd like to do with this watchface in time, but rather than sit on it for another few months, I'd rather share it with my fellow Pebblers and hear first hand what people want.

Enjoy!

data.description:
This Watchface is all about Color!

The hour and minute hands change their color, depending on which part of the outer ring they are pointing at.

Displayed on the right (or left, depending on where the hands are) side is the current date with month and weekday .

Now with step count!
Just shake your wrist and you can peek at the current step count.

My Source Code is on Github now!

The base code for this watchface is from Chris Lewis' "Thin" Watchface.

data.description:
Arsenal inspired watch face for Pebble Time. (Colour, Digital).

Watch face with Arsenal colours.

The examples show (1) 9:20pm, Bluetooth connected, battery level ok, (2) 1806H (24-h style).

- Red hexagons creeps up to indicate the minutes. Hours displayed in numerals.

- A little 'P' in the top right corner indicates it's PM.

- Battery-level indicator:
   > white card outline: charging,
   > yellow card: not more than 20% charge remaining,
   > red card: not more than 10% charge remaining.

- Bluetooth connection indicator:
   > Black artillery background: connected,
   > Bright blue artillery background: alert, disconnected.


- 24 hours style is based on system setting.

Configurable:
- Hourly vibrations with start and end hours.
- Vibration on Bluetooth disconnection.

latest_release.release_notes: Initial release 1.0

data.description:
MtG Color Wheel

Wear this Magic the Gathering Color Wheel on your wrist to show the world your real passion.

Every friday when it‘s time to gather with your friends, this watchface will remind you by display „FNM!“ in the center of your Pebble. It also vibrates at 3 p.m. when it‘s time to leave your work, school or bed to get ready for your Friday Night Magic. In future versions you‘ll be able to set your preferred alarm time.

Have fun playing Magic

Thanks to Marlene. And special thanks to the SpielRaum Crew - http://www.spielraum.co.at
**************************************************

MtG (Magic the Gathering) Farbenrad

Trage den Magic the Gathering Farbenkreis (weiß, blau, schwarz, rot und grün) auf deiner Pebble, um der Welt deine Leidenschaft für Magic zu zeigen.

Jeden Freitag wenn es an der Zeit ist dich mit deinen Freunden zu versammeln, wird dieses Watchface dich daran erinnern indem der Hinweis „FNM!“ in der Mitte der Mana Symbole angezeigt wird. Zusätzlich vibriert um Punkt 15:00 Ortszeit deine Pebble, damit du rechtzeitig aus Arbeit, Schule oder Bett aufbrichst um es rechtzeitig zum Friday Night Magic in deiner Nähe zu schaffen.

Viel Spass beim Magic spielen – am Besten im SpielRaum Wien oder Salzburg - http://www.spielraum.co.at

• Added Forecast Details on shake/tap
• Added Custom Presets
• Added New Icon Set
• Added Weather Underground
• Added Ability to Show/Hide Battery
• Added New Colour Presets
• Settings page overhaul
• Other bug fixes

Version 1.7

• Fixed bug preventing weather from updating
• Added date formats

Version 1.6

• Fixed location bug!
• Quotas were getting smashed - they now have limits.
• Fixed weather update interval bug.

Version 1.5

• minor bug fixes

Version 1.4

• More Preset Colours

Version 1.3

• Added additional generic Weather API Keys due to quota limits.

Version 1.2

• Added larger font size
• Added hour colour
• Added seconds colour
• Added date colour

Version 1.1

• Added new font - Leco
• Added new date formats
• Added option to use your own weather API Keys
• Added new Weather Update Intervals
• Added an option for panel footer text - Weather Condition or Current Location
• Fixed Manual Location input bug
• Other minor bug fixes
• Backend overhaul - Watchface now runs smoother
Instil - Version 1.0

data.description:
Instil is a basic watch face that shows essential information at a glance. Almost every part of the watch face is customisable - from colour configurations to panel layouts.  Instil includes Health data and Weather data as well as cached data to preserve battery wherever possible. 

NEW in Version 1.8

*4.3 bug is fixed in this update

• Added Forecast Details on shake/tap
• Added Custom Presets
• Added New Icon Set
• Added Weather Underground
• Added Ability to Show/Hide Battery
• Added New Colour Presets
• Settings page overhaul
• Other bug fixes

Settings:
• Preset Colour Configurations
• Battery Colour
• Time/Date Colour
• Minute Colour
• Background Colour
• Panel Text/Icon Colour
• Panel Background Colour
• Choice of 2 Fonts: Leco / DIN
• Panel Appearance
• Show Min Weather
• Show Battery %
• Show Steps
• Date Format
• Time Format
• Weather Source (OpenWeatherMap, Forecast.io)
• User weather API Key (optional)
• Celsius / Fahrenheit
• Update Interval
• Manual Location
• Bluetooth Disconnect Warning
• Low Battery Warning

Fonts: Din, Leco, Opensans
Data: OpenWeatherMap / Forecast.io
Icons: Weather Icons / Icons8.com



If you enjoy this watch face, show support by giving it a ❤︎

Bugs? Feel free to let me know: zottiben@gmail.com

changelog.release_notes: First release !

data.description:
Keep all your important informations in one stylish analog/digital watchface.

Data displayed:
- Time (No kidding !)
- Current weather (Provided by Forecast.io)
- Weekday
- Day of the month 
- Battery level
- Steps
- Sleep

Colors customizable.
Minutes marks display option.
Very battery friendly, and the weather updates only when really needed.
Hours vibration option. (quiet time from 10pm to 10am)
data.title: All-In

changelog.release_notes: eliminate watchface degree symbol on hi/low if temp > 99; reduce logging
Lite version is the same as WeatherStep 5.1.  No ticker support for this version.

data.description:
Choices of weather provider = Open Weather, Yahoo Weather, and Weather Underground if you have your own API key.  

Every time a weather update is made, a timeline pin will be created containing weather details.

Other features include Pebble Health steps, and a horizontal line styled battery meter.

If you're not interested in seeing steps, then disable Pebble Health and you'll instead see high/low temperatures.

For ticker options, download the full WeatherStep watchface.

Custom colors allowed for all features.

Inspired by Luis Bento's Timeboxed watchface.

latest_release.release_notes: eliminate watchface degree symbol on hi/low if temp > 99; reduce logging

1.0 - Initial Release

data.description:
The PERFECT watchface for sleeping humans!

Since you don't need to know the time, or have Pebble update the time, whilst you sleep... NightFace keeps the CPU asleep until you shake the watch for the time. It's On-Demand!

A simple shake to the watch will display the time for 5 seconds and then go back to black.

This means the best possible battery savings during the time when you don't need to know the time. You can also use this during the day to conserve battery if you're running low.

If you like NightFace give it a "❤"

And at 5KiB of memory, it has an ultra-tiny footprint!

Watchface built for SDK3 on Original Pebble, Pebble Steel, Pebble Time, Pebble Time Steel, and Pebble Time Round. Displays 12-hour or 24-hour mode!

latest_release.release_notes: 1.3 - Increased font size for time just a tad

data.title: NightFace
